newsitem.title: USA: Bank of Boston approves 12 mln shr buyback.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Boston approves 12 mln shr buyback.

text.p: Bank of Boston Corp Friday said its board approved a repurchase program for up to 12 million shares of its common stock, representing about eight percent of the total shares currently outstanding.

Charles Gifford, chief executive officer said, "Our strategy of managing for value requires that we deploy our capital as productively as possible. As we continue to generate and free up capital via retained earnings, business rationalizations and asset dispositions, this repurchase program gives us greater flexibility to manage our capital."

BankBoston, with assets of $62.3 billion, is engaged primarily in consumer banking in southern New England, providing financing and capital markets services to selected corporations regionally, nationally and internationally, and full-service banking in key Latin American markets.
